Class Boost

  • java.lang.Object
    • RenderableObject
      • Item
        • Boost
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlobalHelper

    public class Boost
extends Item

    Boost

    Represents the Boost item and its effect

    One of the three items that can be used by Player. The most simple to code as it doesn't exist on the map when activated, unlike Tomato and Oil. Applies a Boost effect to the player where their acceleration is increased for a set period of time, and they lose control over whether to move forward or not, with it being locked going forward.
    Author:
    Daniel Porteous porteousd 696965

      • Boost

        public Boost(int startX,
             int startY,
             java.lang.String itemPath)
      throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Standard constructor. Just calls the superclass constructor, placing it on the map in the right location, as well as setting the sprite.
        Parameters:
        startX - In pixels. Horizontal x-coordinate starting position.
        startY - In pixels. Vertical y-coordinate starting position.
        itemPath - The folder name of where the items are stored.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

    • Method Detail

      • applyEffect

        public boolean applyEffect(Racer racer,
                           java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
                    throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        This method applies the effect of the Item to the Racer, namely Player. Sets the players acceleration to the set amount and locks their movement in the forward direction. Once the effect has reached its duration, this method returns true, signifying to the Racer to cease applying the effect and remove it from its active effects.
        Specified by:
        applyEffect in class Item
        Parameters:
        racer - This is the racer on which to apply the effect. As it stands, this will only be used on the Player.
        mapItems - The items array is mandatorily passed into applyEffect as defined by the abstract method in Item, but is not used here.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the effect duration has completed (i.e. Boost duration or duration for which to apply the Oil/Tomato effect).
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

      • update

        public boolean update(World world)
        Because boost doesn't have an active form that physically exists in the game world, there is no need to do anything here.
        Specified by:
        update in class Item
        Parameters:
        world - The world object. Mandatory as per the abstract method in Item, but not used here.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the item being updated needs to be removed from the map, used only for Tomato since its the only item with an additional removal condition that isn't collision with a Racer, namely collision with terrain.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        As above, because the item has no active form in the world this will always just be false.
        Specified by:
        isActive in class Item
        Returns:
        Returns true if the item is in its active state on the map.
